titleStmt.title: Extracts from census declaration [between 298 and 302 AD]
titleStmt.author: Atisios, son of Hatres

msContents.summary: Extracts from the records of the census of 297 taken by Iulius Septimius Sabinus, listing twelve parcels of land of Atisios son of Hatres

msItemStruct.note: Written along the fibers; the back is blank
Three cols with 54 lines of writing; the cols. cross 4 joints of sheets
The space on the left of the first col. was later inscribed with P.Col. VII 146

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from Mr. Blanchard through H.I. Bell in 1924; no. 11 in Bell's inventory

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab:
Copy
From the declarations (for the census) of Sabinus, censitor: village of Karanis, Atisios son of Hatres, of the village of Karanis. Section 4, in the area called Sto, royal land classed arable in year 13, 55/64 ar.; on the east ownerless uninundated land continuously; on the west (property of) Heron; and in the same area, in partnership with Heron, private land classed arable in year 13, 4 25/64 ar., on east and west property of Heron. Section 6, in the area called Tmoueitale, royal land, uninundated, 8 7/16 ar.; on the east (property of) Leonides; on the west an irrigation ditch, then (property of) Pannous. Section 7, in the area called Tapates, royal land, arable, 3 53/64 ar., and in the same area, private land in a palm grove, classed arable in year 12, 5 ar.; on the east an irrigation ditch, then ownerless uninundated land continuously; on the west (property of) Herakles. Section 11, in the area called Peloua, private land, uninundated, 3 1/8 ar.; on the east ownerless uninundated land continuously; on the west dry brush land continuously. Section 13, in the area called Piasokmen, private arable land, 5 45/64 ar.; on the east property of Aboikis; on the west property of Paesios. Section 14, in the same area, private arable land, 14 5/16 ar., and in the same area, private dry land, 1/8 ar.; on the east an irrigation ditch, then the property of Aboikis; on the west....
Column II
Section 18, in the area called Paalama, in partnership with Isidoros and Heron and Helene, private land classed arable in year 14 47/64 ar.; on the east property of Isidoros; on the west dry brush land continuously. Totals: royal arable 4 11/16 ar. private arable 30 9/64 ar. royal uninundated 8 7/16 ar. private uninundated 3 1/8 ar. private brush 1/8 ar.
Volume 2, pages 66-7.
Horiodiktia of the village of Karams Atisis son of Hatres, of the village of Karanis. Section 1, in the area called Talinarty, private arable land, 3 9/64 ar., and in the same area private land, uninundated, 5/16 ar., and in the same area royal arable land, 6 7/8 ar., and in the same area royal land classed arable in year 13, 7/16 ar., and in the same area royal land, uninundated, 9/16 ar., on the east ...; on the west a canal, then dry land continuously.
Column III
Section 5, in the area called Tkaeinpao, private land classed arable [in the 13th year, 2 ar.; on the east (property of) Tauemera; on the west (property of) Paesios. Section 7, in the area called Parnmars, private arable land, [...] ar.; on the east (property of) Serenius; on the west (property of) Paesios. Section 8, in the area called Kalatous, private arable land, [..]. ar.; on the cast (property of) Taesis; on the west (property of) Isidoros.
Totals: royal arable 7 5/16 ar. private arable 10 25/64 ar. royal uninundated 9/16 ar. private uninundated 5/16 ar. Volume 2, pages 79-80.
Total altogether of the two declarations: royal arable 12 ar. royal uninundated 9 ar. private arable 40 17/32 ar. private uninundated 3 7/16 ar.

listBibl.bibl: P.Col. VII 124 P.Coll.Youtie II 76, editio princeps Related texts: P.Mich. XII 626 (copy of lines 2-29) and 636; P.NYU 20; mentioned in P.Cair.Isid. 2 (p. 30) and 6 (p. 54); plate, P.Col. VII, Microfiche 1
